funFacts: The "Word-Cross" became "Cross-Word" due to a typesetter's error, and the name stuck.
Arthur Wynne published the first crossword in 1913.
Monday puzzles are typically the easiest; they get harder through the week.

howto.title: How to play
basics: All answers are written left-to-right (across) or top-to-bottom (down) - never diagonally or backwards.
Multi-word answers are written without spaces (e.g., put on → puton).
Clues are concise and often include clever wordplay, abbreviations, or puns.
Proper nouns, slang, and pop culture references are commonly used.

controls.label: Mouse
controls.text: Highlight the clue or its corresponding grid cells

tips.title: Use Crossings
tips.body: Once you solve a clue, use it to help solve the intersecting words. Just one correct answer can unlock several others.

tips.title: Double-Check Your Answers
tips.body: A single incorrect letter can throw off the entire puzzle. If something feels off or forced, take a step back and reassess.

tips.title: Play Every Day
tips.body: Like any muscle, your brain gets stronger with regular use. Daily practice sharpens your skills and speeds up your solving.

footer.aboutText:
A crossword a day keeps the doctor away.
I post a new mini every morning - quick, fun, and hopefully a little clever.
